column41: Sometimes we get rid of the skin. Because some people don’t like to eat it with the skin
column42: blue shark and milk shark is the best

column12: 2/3 boxes each week, and dry shark comes in 30kg per box, and 20/25kg of dried ray per box.
column13: We buy 2 boxes per week of rays. There is also buy shark in boxes.
column14: They dry in the vadi- we keep some. One week -2 times they dry. Rain we don’t get. If not raining we always get
column15: Before we use to sell more but now other vendors get from people drying at home. We buy from vadi- then we keep a 100 or so, but they get more profit or can sell more for less
column17: mobular ray , rhino ray , eagle ray
column42: rhino ray is good. Sometimes we just get as shark or ray, and no particular species really

column9: We can’t really tell for sure, because we go to the drying complex and we sell what is avaliable
column12: When 20/25kg (~23) of dry shark is bought, it takes a week or two (~1.5 weeks) to finish selling this amount. This is the same for ray, and it’s rare to finish waht I buy that day. 15kg can be sold in a week normally
column14: Not really they always have
column15: Sinhala new year I sell more. 10th of the month I sell good and after the 25th I sell good. Because of people getting pay.
column17: blue shark, leopard whipray, milk shark , hammerhead shark, eagle ray
column42: eagle ray is the best for taste. Some shark can go upto 2000, for example thresher shark can be more expensive, but we try to find them for less. They are tasty. We normally keep 100/150 profit for each kg sold

column12: 100-200kg of ray can be caught sometimes.
column14: Now less- varakan you get more- may, june, july
column15: When people get colds, people eat it less. Big maduwa always go
column17: blue spotted maskray
column42: We normally just sell small rays such as the blue spotted-maskray, because with the big ones we have to cut them. And we need to spend more money to get people to cut the meat

column9: I sell less ray than shark
column12: Always sell one shark and a half, and one shark can be between 50-60kg. One big ray can be between 60-70kg
column14: May- April
column15: New year and December
column17: mobular ray , milk shark , silky shark , blue spotted-maskray
column42: milk shark

column12: Less fish now. Today we dealt with 20,000kg shark and ray
column13: Can change, once sold 85,000 in one day during corona
column14: International seas- all the time we get.
column15: All for dry fish- some times for fresh fish. Price was low before but now a bit high. Today we have fish from 5 boats use to be just one. Sinhala new year close. Dry fish demand increases. Vesak and dansal, people who go for boats go on holiday. Mostly to Badulla, polonaruwa, where it’s hot people eat less dry fish.
column17: mobular ray , manta ray , milk shark , silky shark , sicklefin devil ray
column41: There are around 10 varieties of shark. We catch cownose rays some days, and they get caught in nets. This happens in October
column42: deep sharks are the best variety. When dried, they are tasty and nice looking. mobular ray also has a lot of demand
